uk.ac.ebi.efo.bubastis

Class CompareOntologies

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ebi.efo.bubastis.CompareOntologies

  • public class CompareOntologies
extends java.lang.Object
    Version:
    1.02 Use the CompareOntologies class and subsequent doFindAllChanges methods to invoke a diff between two ontologies. Diff results can be output to xml file using the writeDiffAsXMLFile method
    Author:
    James Malone

      Method for walking through all the classes in a given ontology and comparing with classes in another given ontology and identifying differences in axioms between any two identical classes - identical here to mean having same class URI

      • doFindAllChanges

        public void doFindAllChanges(java.lang.String ontology1Location,
                    java.lang.String ontology2Location)
        Perform diff on two ontologies supplying just two ontology locations as strings.
        Parameters:
        ontology1Location - - location of first ontology - the older ontology in most cases
        ontology2Location - - location of second ontology - the newer ontology in most cases

        public void doFindAllChanges(java.io.File ontologyFile1,
                    java.io.File ontologyFile2)
        Perform diff on two ontologies passed as files
        Parameters:
        ontologyFile1 - - first ontology to be read from file
        ontologyFile2 - - second ontology to be read from file

                    java.io.File ontologyFile2)
        Perform diff on two ontologies, first passed as a URL, second as a file
        Parameters:
        ontology1Location - - first ontology to be read from URL
        ontologyFile2 - - second ontology to be read from file

      • doFindAllChanges

        public void doFindAllChanges(java.io.File ontologyFile1,
                    java.lang.String ontology2Location)
        Perform diff on two ontologies, first passed as a URL, second as a file
        Parameters:
        ontologyFile1 - - first ontology to be read from file
        ontology2Location - - second ontology to be read from URL

      • doFindAllChanges

        public void doFindAllChanges(org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntologyManager manager1,
                    org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntologyManager manager2,
                    org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntology ont1,
                    org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntology ont2)
        Perform diff on two ontologies supplying the two OWLOntologyManager classes and the two OWLOntology classes which have the ontologies pre-loaded
        Parameters:
        manager1 - ontology manager with the first ontology (ont1) loaded
        manager2 - ontology manager with the second ontology (ont2) loaded
        ont1 - first ontology to be compared (the older ontology in most cases)
        ont2 - second ontology to compare to ont1 (the newer ontology in most cases)

      • compareAllClassAxioms

        public java.util.ArrayList<OWLClassAxiomsInfo> compareAllClassAxioms(org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntologyManager manager1,
                                                            org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntology ont1,
                                                            org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntologyManager manager2,
                                                            org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntology ont2)
        Method for walking through all the classes in a given ontology and comparing with classes in another given ontology and identifying differences in axioms between any two identical classes - identical here to mean having same class URI
        Parameters:
        manager1 - ontology manager with the first ontology (ont1) loaded
        manager2 - ontology manager with the first ontology (ont2) loaded
        ont1 - first ontology to be compared (the older ontology in most cases)
        ont2 - second ontology to compare to ont1 (the newer ontology in most cases)

      • findDeletedClasses

        public java.util.ArrayList<OWLClassAxiomsInfo> findDeletedClasses(org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntologyManager manager1,
                                                         org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntology ont1,
                                                         org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntologyManager manager2,
                                                         org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntology ont2)
        method to find classes that have been deleted, that is classes that appear in ontology 1 but not in ontology 2. It chains to the findNewClasses and simply reverses the order, i.e. classes in ontology 1 but not in ontology 2
        Parameters:
        manager1 - ontology manager with the first ontology (ont1) loaded
        manager2 - ontology manager with the first ontology (ont2) loaded
        ont1 - first ontology to be compared (the older ontology in most cases)
        ont2 - second ontology to compare to ont1 (the newer ontology in most cases)

      • findNewClasses

        public java.util.ArrayList<OWLClassAxiomsInfo> findNewClasses(org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntologyManager manager1,
                                                     org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntology ont1,
                                                     org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntologyManager manager2,
                                                     org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.OWLOntology ont2)
        method to find classes that are 'new', that is classes that appear in ontology 2 but not in ontology 1
        Parameters:
        manager1 - ontology manager with the first ontology (ont1) loaded
        manager2 - ontology manager with the first ontology (ont2) loaded
        ont1 - first ontology to be compared (the older ontology in most cases)
        ont2 - second ontology to compare to ont1 (the newer ontology in most cases)

      • writeDiffAsXMLFile

        public void writeDiffAsXMLFile(java.lang.String filePath)
        write diffs as an XML file
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path of the file which the xml will be written - will replace an existing file if in the same location
